Posts.Content: Jacks77 how do you go about getting this test. I'm happy to pay for it? Tks x
Posts.Title: Oncotype dx

Posts.Content: Thank you. Since i was diagnosed on 22nd Dec not even seen a Oncologist has been Surgeons to date. I was told Friday by surgeon I'll get appoimtment in next 3 weeks to see one and to consider chemo, but my choice if it was decided in my treatment plan. I had my Op 18th Jan so not exactly rushing are they as gonna be near on 2 months since Op x
Posts.Title: Oncotype dx

Posts.Content: Tks so much. I'll let you know outcome. Yes now i wait again for a letter in post with appointment. I hope all is going as well as can be expected for you xx
Posts.Title: Oncotype dx

Posts.Content: Interesting question seeing as mine came back in the grey area. Isn't Chemo to mop up any cells that could be lerking in Blood? X
Posts.Title: Quedtion re High Oncotype Score: Would a Mastectomy be as effective...

Posts.Content: I've had this pain also i call it more like Twinges for me, was if i lifted arm to turn shower on or reach high for something. I had a WLE with sentinel lymph nodes removed on Jan 18th. Today i suddenly realised i haven't got it anymore. I just prodded ribs and no pain. Must of gone in last few days and I've just got use to it so never noticed x
Posts.Title: Rib pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Haha for me was my PG Tips lol. Seeing your post is what has made me realised mine has gone. Have done all my horses today and now I'm thinking not had one twinge. Your Op was obviously bigger than mine so will take longer x
Posts.Title: Rib pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Marriane I had the Op in Jan and it wasn't bad at all. I was itching to be back at my horses within 2 days but having to tell myself i was healing inside and to slow down. The sentinel biospy does feel weird tho as i think they move nerves so you have this numb feeling.  The waiting part isn't the easiest as I'm all for cracking on but I'll hold your hand as you toodle down to theatre for you to have a little nap and have the tea and biscuits ready for your return. When i went for results afterwards to be told you are cancer free it's a great day.  Now I've just started tamoxifen and waiting to go to radiotherapy. Take one day at a time x
Posts.Title: I’ve been lurking.....

Posts.Content: Thanks. He said I'm high end of the Grey Area as to whether it out ways side effects but close to the defo benefit bracket at 31. Bit of a surprise as they had only spoken RT and Tamoxifen before today x
Posts.Title: Onco Test Results

Posts.Content: Tks all for input, I'll keep you updated on decision Coco, I'm just not sure if i want to risk it as i have 3 kids at school who all bring germs home. I can get cover for horses but not for 6 months. I'm certainly not parting with my dogs as suggested.  Nurse was saying to monitor my temp as if i become ill i will become ill so fast i won't be able to ring for help myself. I thought blimey don't sugar coat it then.  I'm going to look on letters I've got that were also sent to doctors as don't remember seeing any results like that. Xx Edit..... no ER numbers on my copy of letters to Doctor so will ask for them Monday x
Posts.Title: Onco Test Results

Posts.Content: Is that temporary in hands and feet as my usual day is over 20,000 steps? If i was to go thro this I'd not want to end up being able to do less once it's all over xx
Posts.Title: Onco Test Results

Posts.Content: I've never been given any of them scores. How would i find out? Tks
Posts.Title: Onco Test Results

Posts.Content: Thank you Tallantire. I have been looking at all the different types of cycles and i know when i go back for plan they're gonna say 'Oh hell here she comes again' as i always have questions.  One minute I'm like ok I need to think of the worry I'm putting others thro and just have it, then I'm thinking all my family have died from heart attacks my mum was only 56yrs old so chances are high that's what'll get me and it can damage heart anyway. Just can't decide when plan was Op then 3 weeks Rads with Tamoxifen to suddenly have this thrown in and by people who haven't been in our position so flippantly x
Posts.Title: Onco Test Results

Posts.Content: Hi Had my Results today Onco test 28. Now my lifestyle is my Horses and Dogs. She said she'd prefer me not to go to horses for 6 months once treatment starts and of course my Dogs going no where.  So to possibly Chemo or not to Chemo is my decision, not sure type. Got to see Oncologists in next 3 weeks with what her plan is. Others results were Grade 3, 25mm, ER+ and HER2- with clear margins on Lumpectomy and No Nodes involved. Honest opinions please Tks x
Posts.Title: Onco Test Results

Posts.Content: Hi All Thanks so much for all your replies. BarryBattler when you say Could walk your dog again was there a time you couldn't? I'd expect some days I'd feel ill i know this but trying to get as much info as i can.  Really appreciate all your help x
Posts.Title: Onco Test Results

Posts.Content: Thanks Ladies. I feel so well I'm trying to imagine feeling rough for 6 months as I'm never poorly xx
Posts.Title: Onco Test Results

Posts.Content: I went Doctors 4th Dec and was referred cause of lump and indent in right boob. Got seen 2 weeks later on 18th Dec. Examination, mammogram, ultrasound and core biospy and marker put in so i knew something weren't right. Then back into see consultant who said whatever it is is treatable. Called in for results on 22nd, another examination and boobs measured from all angles. Results weren't the news i was hoping as saw something on left as well. Back for contrast enhanced mammogram on 3rd Jan as Xmas slowed it down, and left boob was fine but i have it in right boob. Had my pre op 4th and now gotta see surgeon on 12th to see if his 'provisional' surgery he has booked will go ahead. I hope you get good news. The waiting is hard. Don't google as hard as that is or stick to English Cancer groups. My BCN told me to steer clear of American sites. It has gone quickly so hang in there xx
Posts.Title: Worried about breast lump I’m beside myself with worry

Posts.Content: Catlover further up i wrote everything they have done to me so far. I'm not much further ahead than you. I've had alot of waiting because of Christmas. Today i got my medical exemption card come thro as on results appointment the BCN had me sign it. Oh on test days they won't allow your son past the first waiting room so he may have a long wait out front from what i saw with all the Males that were with people. I'm going friday for another results appointment from other tests I've had done and hopefully to sign Operation forms x
Posts.Title: Worried about breast lump I’m beside myself with worry

Posts.Content: You may find you don't have it. They tested me for left breast as i have a 29mm spot on ultrasound they were concerned about but that was Fibroadenoma. X
Posts.Title: Worried about breast lump I’m beside myself with worry

Posts.Content: Hi Thought I'd reply as I'm 4 weeks ahead of you. Them feelings under arm of numbness and i had electric shock type feelings i believe are as nerves which are disturbed or cut during lymph node removal are healing. My boob i had no bother with but under arm was not painful just a uncomfortably weird feeling. 4 weeks since operation and now in shower when you shave armpits i can actually feel razor where as before i felt nothing. Hope you get good results x
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy and now numb breast

Posts.Content: Only 2 days for me. Headache within a few hours of first tablet and not something i suffer from. Woke in night to really bad pains in knees. Couldn't sleep. Dry mouth, then today most of the afternoon being sick. Ate some ginger nuts and felt better. Headache went as did sickness. Taken to nights one and dry mouth is back and can feel that headache coming back and bang pain in knees is back. Can this be due to the tablets as felt fine 2 days ago? X
Posts.Title: Early side effects of tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Wow!! You're amazing to of gone thro so much and be nearly at finishing line xx
Posts.Title: New here

Posts.Content: Tks i think she would if i have it, Will do it's next Friday. I'm at the long waiting stage between different appointments but hopefully getting closer to knowing his Plan now x

Posts.Content: Hi Just wondering if anyone new about this as just received my letter from hospital. IDC with Medullary type Features. Bilateral axillary Ultrasound Normal, ER and HER2 status awaited? Thank you x

I'm 47 but my mum died age 56 from heart attack so will never know if she carried it. If so my sister will need testing wouldn't she? X
